title: smoothie
author: smoothie
created_time: December 30, 2022, 09:18:48 PMLast edit: January 18, 2023, 12:44:40 AM by smoothie
content: Contestants Gallery of XMAS Decoration Lealana Contest 1__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________1) montreal12) MoparMiningLLC3) Dr.Bitcoin_Strange4) minerjones5) TxCryptoKid6) saxoshi7) MarkZellers8 ) Kryptowerk9) aoluain10) cryptogreatdaneContestants Gallery of XMAS Decoration General Contest 2__________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________________1) Shaha982) Dubaian3) Cygan4) Tjtonmoy5) Dr.Bitcoin_Strange6) Mbitr7) xSlyy8 ) Burugcrypto9) Remsjack10) TxCryptoKid11) Woodrose12) Amphenomenon13) Patrol6914) Kryptowerk15) aoluain16) Helena Yu17) Ryu_Ar1Voting begins now for Contest #1 & #2. How the Poll is to be RunPoll will run until January 6th 2023 at 11:59pm EST.  1 vote per user (you are NOT allowed to use your alt account to vote twice). You can change your vote, of course only up until the contest ends.  IMPORTANT: This will be an OPEN voting system. Pick your top three entrants for each contest and post it. You will be required to post only once in this thread your votes for 1st, 2nd, 3rd places in each contest. You cannot duplicate a 1st, 2nd, or 3rd place for a user unless it is in the other contest. Here is an example of a user’s votes:Code:Contest 11st place - tom2nd place - dick3rd place - harryContest 21st place - Joe2nd place - Larry3rd place - IkaikaIMPORTANT NOTES:Once the 7 days is up, the voting will end. I will tally all of the votes and announce the winners. NO NEW ACCOUNTS CAN VOTE. Your bitcointalk.org account has to be at least 2 months old in order to vote and had been active (your last post prior to voting post) in the last 3 months to count as a vote.In the unlikely case of a tie, we'll run another poll which will be set to run for 3 days.Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on December 31, 2022, 01:09:01 AMI am confused - are we voting for who actually gets first place? or just our top 3 favorites? curious because what if a contestant gets 5 votes for 1st, 5 votes for 2nd and 5 votes for 3rd - with only 5 votes in each of placement, they obviously lose if the voting is by placement instead of total overall votes, in which case they would have 15 votes.Winners will be selected by total points accrued by all votes cast as follows:1st place vote = 3 points2nd place vote = 2 points3rd place vote = 1 pointEach place carries a weight in points. Most points wins 1st place, second most wins 2nd place etc..No manipulation of any kind allowed. If I see you trying to manipulate the votes in any way, I reserve the right to disqualify you. Please no alt-accounts, no begging for votes etc.  If there any typos in links I will correct them as I find them. If there is anything I forgot it will be posted here asap.Mahalo for all the entries. This truly was a great first year for the xmas decoration contest.

comments.author: smoothie
comments.body: reservededit: is anyone else seeing the first column of entrants as smaller sized thumbnails than the rest of the contest entrants?Very odd as the preview shows it as showing up the right size, but when finalizing it it is smaller than the rest.Hmm

comments.body: Quote from: smoothie on December 30, 2022, 09:20:19 PMedit: is anyone else seeing the first column of entrants as smaller sized thumbnails than the rest of the contest entrants?Yes.One easy fix is to make a first row of underlines and adjust by those the column withsEdit: if that's OK for you, an option with that code of this table "fixed" (with added underscores) is in this post.Code:Contest 11st place - minerjones2nd place - Dr.Bitcoin_Strange3rd place - KryptowerkContest 21st place - Helena Yu2nd place - Mbitr3rd place - Cygan

comments.author: Kryptowerk
comments.body: This wasn't an easy one, happy to see quite a few creative and beautiful entries.Contest 11st place - aoluain2nd place - TxCryptoKid3rd place - cryptogreatdaneContest 21st place - Helena Yu2nd place - Remsjack3rd place - xSlyyQuote from: smoothie on December 30, 2022, 09:20:19 PMreservededit: is anyone else seeing the first column of entrants as smaller sized thumbnails than the rest of the contest entrants?Very odd as the preview shows it as showing up the right size, but when finalizing it it is smaller than the rest. HmmYes I do. Using latest Firefox. Rechecked with Chrome and it's the same. Weird.Interestingly enough, when typing a response and seeing your OP in this view, everything seems normal-sized.

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: I am confused - are we voting for who actually gets first place? or just our top 3 favorites? curious because what if a contestant gets 5 votes for 1st, 5 votes for 2nd and 5 votes for 3rd - with only 5 votes in each of placement, they obviously lose if the voting is by placement instead of total overall votes, in which case they would have 15 votes.

comments.author: owlcatz
comments.body: Dammmn this wasn't easy, and still bummed I never had time to enter either!  1:CryptogreatdaneKryptowerkMark Zellers2:CyganKryptowerkAlouainGreat work & Happy new years to you all too, especially to the Smoothinator himself.

comments.author: smoothie
comments.body: Quote from: MoparMiningLLC on December 31, 2022, 01:09:01 AMI am confused - are we voting for who actually gets first place? or just our top 3 favorites? curious because what if a contestant gets 5 votes for 1st, 5 votes for 2nd and 5 votes for 3rd - with only 5 votes in each of placement, they obviously lose if the voting is by placement instead of total overall votes, in which case they would have 15 votes.Great point. I half thought it out.But here is a simple solution to your exampled dilemma.1st place vote = 3 points2nd place vote = 2 points3rd place vote = 1 pointEach place carries a weight in points. Most points wins 1st place, second most wins 2nd place etc..

comments.author: MoparMiningLLC
comments.body: ouch so someone with the most votes could still actually lose lol this will be fun - can win first with 1/3 of the votes.

comments.author: Helena Yu

comments.author: xSlyy
comments.body: I haven't had this much fun doing arts and crafts since preschool. Thanks for hosting this Smoothie!Here are my votes.Contest 11.) CryptoGreatDane - I showed this to my family and everybody enjoyed it, it was... cute said most. "Oh no! My coin is buyer funded"  2.) MoparMiningLLC - Very neat 3D print especially for the occasion which seems to double as a hidden Lealana stash. Points for creativity!3.) MarkZellers - The story associated with this is very heartfelt and personal. Points for orange pilling the younger generation.Contest 21.) TxCryptoKid - That has to be the most insane Liquid collection I've seen yet. What a set!2.) aoluain - As a fan of aoluain's coloring books, I love seeing a Christmas design from them.3.) HelenaYu - Great coin artwork and Bitcoin Donuts, enough said.Happy New Year all. I hope everyone can close this year out with great memories, lessons learned, and a positive mindset for 2023.BTCBTCBTC

comments.author: bitbollo
comments.body: Contest 11st place - aoluain2nd place - Kryptowerk3rd place - cryptogreatdaneContest 21st place - TxCryptoKid2nd place - Mbitr3rd place - TjtonmoyHappy New Year to all of you fellow collectors and bitcoiner!

comments.author: Mbitr
comments.body: Thanks again smoothie for the opportunity and for an awesome contest  My picks…Contest 11st place - cryptogreatdane A lot of effort put into this AND very cool  2nd place - MarkZellersAgain, a lot of effort AND a real family affair  3rd place - MoparMiningLLCLove the Hawaiian touch Contest 21st place - xSlyyI imagine this was rather tricky to do - well done  2nd place - Helena Yu A beautiful and intricate design 3rd place - TxCryptoKidAn amazing collection  Good luck to all the contestants and most importantly….. HAPPY NEW YEAR

comments.author: Cryptogreatdane
comments.body: What a great holiday contest. A big thank you to Smoothie and all the participants. Lots of creativity and effort to spread the holiday cheer and incorporate physical bitcoin into the Christmas spirit. Love how this community is growing and working together for the advancement of physical. Here is to an awesome start to 2023.Contest 11. Mark Zellers- Original pastel artwork with great theme2. Mopar Mining- New world craftsmanship.3. Saxoshi- Love the holiday feel and colorsContest 21. Tjtonmay- Original drawing with heart2. XSly- Snow globes are hard to work with3. Cygan- The holiday collection of collections
